title: France Electric Vehicle Market: USD 34.74 Bn Forecast by 2029
text:
France Electric Vehicle Market: USD 34.74 Bn Forecast by 2029 01-10-2025 05:01 AM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research
Press release from: Maximize Market Research Pvt. Ltd. France Electric Vehicle Market
ð…ð«ðšð§ðœðž'ð¬ ð„ð¥ðžðœð­ð«ð¢ðœ ð•ðžð¡ð¢ðœð¥ðž ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ðð¨ð¢ð¬ðžð ðŸð¨ð« ð’ð¢ð ð§ð¢ðŸð¢ðœðšð§ð­ ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡
The French electric vehicle (EV) market is on an accelerated growth trajectory, with projections indicating a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 9.1% from 2023 to 2029. The market size, valued at USD 18.88 billion in 2022, is anticipated to reach nearly USD 34.74 billion by 2029.
ðŠðžð² ðƒð«ð¢ð¯ðžð«ð¬ ð¨ðŸ ð†ð«ð¨ð°ð­ð¡
Several factors contribute to this robust expansion:
ð‘®ð’ð’—ð’†ð’“ð’ð’Žð’†ð’ð’• ð‘°ð’ð’Šð’•ð’Šð’‚ð’•ð’Šð’—ð’†ð’”: France's commitment to environmental sustainability is evident through policies aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The government's plan to ban new cars producing greenhouse emissions by 2040 and the goal to have a fleet of 1 million Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs) and Plug-in Hybrid Electric Vehicles (PHEVs) by 2022 underscore this commitment.
ð‘°ð’ð’‡ð’“ð’‚ð’”ð’•ð’“ð’–ð’„ð’•ð’–ð’“ð’† ð‘«ð’†ð’—ð’†ð’ð’ð’‘ð’Žð’†ð’ð’•: The expansion of public charging stations across urban and highway locations enhances convenience for EV owners, further encouraging adoption.
ð‘«ð’Šð’—ð’†ð’“ð’”ð’† ð‘¬ð‘½ ð‘´ð’ð’…ð’†ð’ð’”: Consumers in France have access to a wide range of EV models, from compact city cars to luxury vehicles, catering to various preferences and budgets.

The global EV landscape is dynamic, with various countries experiencing unique trends and developments:
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™‚ð™§ð™¤ð™¬ð™©ð™ ð™žð™£ ð™‘ð™žð™šð™©ð™£ð™–ð™¢
Vietnam's EV market is experiencing rapid growth, with a projected CAGR of 18% from 2024 to 2029. The market size is expected to reach USD 5.67 billion by 2029, up from USD 2.48 billion in 2024. Government initiatives, such as tax benefits and investments in charging infrastructure, are significant drivers of this growth.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™Šð™¥ð™¥ð™¤ð™§ð™©ð™ªð™£ð™žð™©ð™žð™šð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð™ð™ð™–ð™žð™¡ð™–ð™£ð™™
Thailand is positioning itself as a future powerhouse in Southeast Asia's EV market. The market is expected to experience a CAGR of 5.06% from 2024 to 2028, resulting in a projected market volume of USD 1,344 million by 2028. Government support and consumer interest in eco-friendly transportation are key factors propelling this growth.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™§ð™šð™£ð™™ð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð™…ð™–ð™¥ð™–ð™£
Japanese automakers are intensifying their focus on EVs to compete with global manufacturers. For instance, ð‡ð²ð®ð§ððšð¢ ðŒð¨ð­ð¨ð« has introduced the Hyundai Inster, a compact electric car priced at $18,000, to penetrate the Japanese market.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð˜¾ð™¤ð™£ð™¨ð™¤ð™¡ð™žð™™ð™–ð™©ð™žð™¤ð™£ ð™žð™£ ð™Žð™¤ð™ªð™©ð™ ð™†ð™¤ð™§ð™šð™–
South Korea's automotive industry is witnessing significant investments in EV development. ð‡ð²ð®ð§ððšð¢ ðŒð¨ð­ð¨ð« ð†ð«ð¨ð®ð© plans to invest a record $16.7 billion in 2025 to accelerate its transition to electric vehicles, including $11.5 billion in research and development and $12 billion in upgrading facilities for EV production.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™¥ð™™ð™–ð™©ð™žð™¤ð™£ ð™žð™£ ð™Žð™žð™£ð™œð™–ð™¥ð™¤ð™§ð™š
Singapore is actively promoting EV adoption through various initiatives, including the expansion of charging infrastructure and incentives for EV buyers. The government's commitment to sustainable transportation is evident in its policies aimed at reducing carbon emissions.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™‚ð™§ð™¤ð™¬ð™©ð™ ð™žð™£ ð™©ð™ð™š ð™ð™£ð™žð™©ð™šð™™ ð™Žð™©ð™–ð™©ð™šð™¨
The U.S. EV market is expanding, with increased adoption driven by consumer demand and government incentives. Automakers are introducing a variety of EV models to cater to diverse consumer preferences, contributing to the market's growth.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™§ð™šð™£ð™™ð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð˜¾ð™ð™žð™£ð™–
China is poised to become the world's leading market for electric vehicles, expected to surpass internal combustion engine car sales in 2025. This transition reflects China's advances in EV technology and a robust supply chain for essential components.
ð™ð™§ð™–ð™£ð™˜ð™š ð™€ð™¡ð™šð™˜ð™©ð™§ð™žð™˜ ð™‘ð™šð™ð™žð™˜ð™¡ð™š ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™Šð™¥ð™¥ð™¤ð™§ð™©ð™ªð™£ð™žð™©ð™žð™šð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð™€ð™ªð™§ð™¤ð™¥ð™š
Europe continues to be a significant player in the global EV market, with various countries implementing policies to promote EV adoption. The expansion of charging infrastructure and government incentives are contributing to the market's growth across the continent.

Battery electric passenger cars
Battery electric light commercial vehicles
Vehicle Type: Plug-in hybrid passenger cars, plug-in hybrid light commercial vehicles, battery electric passenger cars, battery electric light commercial vehicles, hybrid electric passenger cars, and hybrid electric light commercial vehicles make up the market. With a market share of approximately 44.6% in 2022, the Battery Electric Passenger Cars sector led the France Electric Vehicle market. This is because battery electric passenger cars, or "BEVs," are becoming more and more popular. Longer driving ranges are a result of battery technology developments. There is less worry about running out of electricity when driving thanks to the wide range of many contemporary BEVs, which can comfortably cover longer excursions and everyday commutes.
ð›ð² ð‚ð¡ðšð«ð ð¢ð§ð  ð“ð²ð©ðž
Normal Charging
Fast Charging
The market is separated into two segments based on the type of charging: normal charging and fast charging. The market was dominated by the Normal Charging sector, which had the biggest share. Many EV owners in France would rather use a standard charging station at home to power their cars. This is because it is a practical choice for them to charge overnight, particularly given the demands of everyday commuting. It can be charged overnight because it takes a few hours. For employees who park their EVs throughout the workday, regular charging stations are also frequently utilised to offer a slow and comfortable charging option.
